channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Christmas tree blocking pavement, 2nd February
item.description:
This tree has been here for more than two weeks now and no one has moved it. It's hard to get a pram or wheelchair through (we have two wheelchair users who live on the street and they struggle). Please pick it up and remove it. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rainbow Street, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 2nd February
item.description:
Rubbish on public land. Abandoned trolley on pathway filled with rubbish. Litter bins should be installed

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bugsbys Way, Charlton

item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osbaldeston Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Excessive Litter at the bottom of the steps at the Andrews Road and Sheep Lane junction 3-4 bags of rubbish that the foxes have ripped open., 2nd February
item.description:

item.title: Incorrectly parked car LV73WUJ, 2nd February
item.description:
This red Hyundai periodically parks on eastbound side of Lennard Terrace and has been there for last 2 days unchecked/unmoved. There is a clear no parking/waiting sign on this stretch - add to that, it is a single lane, with a bus stop and busy and this car will cause congestion/ accidents during peak hours. Please can the council/enforcement review and take action, thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lennard Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Balloon cannisters/debris/boxes on glass verge on Luddesdon Road, 2nd February
item.description:
This part of the road is used for using this substance by people in cars and throwing debris on the grass verges on either side of the road, this includes empty alcohol bottles. The road is used as a route to Belmont School and the items are a risk to children

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Luddesdon Road, Upper Belvedere, Greater London

item.description:

item.title: There’s a crossing with bollards but on one side no dropped kerb and pedestrians have to cross a muddy grass verge, 2nd February
item.description:
There’s a pedestrian crossing point with bollards. The east side of the crossing requires pedestrians to walk on muddy verge - grass has worn away. It should be a footpath here for safety and accessibility.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
